{"step_by_step_thinking": "Factor VIII is a blood clotting factor that is deficient in patients with Hemophilia A. The best source of factor VIII is cryoprecipitate, which is a concentrated source of factor VIII. Fresh whole blood and FFP (Fresh Frozen Plasma) also contain factor VIII, but in lower concentrations. Platelet concentrate is not a good source of factor VIII.", "answer_choice": "B"}
